articles.author: Martha Tesema
articles.title: Fox News contributor suggests it was a 'compliment' when Trump called Omarosa a 'dog'
articles.description: Remember when Donald Trump, our sitting president, called Omarosa " that dog " after news broke that she'd recorded with him and others during her time at the White House? It was both racist and sexist — and definitely was not said from a place of love. But i…

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Britain apologizes to migrants removed in Windrush scandal
articles.description: Britain said it would formally apologize to 18 members of the "Windrush generation" who were forced to leave or detained because they were not issued with documents when they came to the country from the Caribbean after World War Two.

articles.author: Alexandra Ma
articles.title: The US has deported a 95-year-old Nazi concentration camp guard who was living in Queens
articles.description: Jakiw Palij, a 95-year-old former Nazi concentration camp guard, was deported early Tuesday morning. He had been living on welfare in Queens, New York, until his deportation. He landed in Dusseldorf, Germany, on Tuesday. Palij worked at the Trawniki Labor Cam…

articles.author: USA TODAY, John Fritze, USA TODAY
articles.title: President Trump plans to step up midterm travel, outpace Obama
articles.description: Trump will spend more than 40 days on the campaign trail ahead of the midterm elections, aiming to dedicate more time than Barack Obama did in 2010.

articles.author: smurray@politico.com (Stephanie Murray)
articles.title: Trump warns 'blue wave' would bring 'crime and open borders'
articles.description: Trump has long predicted that November's midterms will deliver a "red wave" of Republican victories, shielding or perhaps bolstering GOP majorities in both houses of Congress.

articles.title: Once-safe GOP seats threatened by blue wave
articles.description: Rep. Steve Chabot and others are facing tough races for the first time in years.

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.title: Canadian refugee ruling unfair to Nigerians: lawyers
articles.description: A group of Canadian refugee lawyers is taking the government to court over a recent immigration ruling, calling it unfair to Nigerian asylum seekers who have streamed across the border from the United States in large numbers over the past 18 months.

articles.description: The fight for religious liberty abroad is now as much a source of partisan division as the religious-freedom cause in America.

articles.title: Donald Trump’s GOP Is Surprisingly Good at Minority Outreach
